title: Unable to download spectator data, this game will now exit.
body: Why is this still happening? I used to have NOOO problem spectating games and now I am unable to watch a game for more than 30 seconds before it freezes, only to pick back up 30 seconds later, and then repeat this process twice more and then disconnect me. I am the network admin at my RV park and have done all the required port forwarding and still am unable to spectate. I can play just fine, no lag no disconnects, but this spectate game function is fubar. This is something on RIOT's end, not on mine as I can watch the packets loss as spectating, its as if your server drops and reconnects during spectating and after a certain amount of drops, automatically disconnects. Is this a known issue and is there any progress being made to correct this issue. I understand you are a huge company and you have tons of issues that come up but this is one that has been going on for a long time now. Can we please get a Red Update here? Anything that lets me know this problem is being addressed and working on being corrected, or if there is something else I need to do on my end I would love to hear that as well, although I am VERY certain its nothing with my end, as this is happening to all my friends from many other states and cities. Thank you for your time and I hope to hear something soon.

replies.body:
Hi StillwawterPlaya,

Can you please do the following:

- Press windows key + r to open up "run"
- Type "cmd" and hit enter
- In command prompt type "ping 192.64.174.163 -t" (note the spaces after ping and before -t)
- Let this run for a few minutes
- Press Ctrl+c after these few  minutes, and it should end
- Upload a screenshot of what you can see on screen. You should get something like the following:

http://gyazo.com/08f0ef3af5a000cdae50c4a932da8440

(My loss is actually pretty high here due to me being in the UK, and also I only ran it for a minute)
Thank you sir for the reply but as i stated I have done all of the above steps and still no fix. Im positive its on Riots end here as others have same issue not just me.

Hey Stillwater,

Could you attach the r3d Log for the game that you were spectating and disconnected from? This will give me a little more insight as to why you're not able to connect to the Spectate client and help us investigate this issue further!

You can find the r3d logs at this location on your computer:

Your Install Path (Usually C:) > Riot Games > League of Legends > Logs > Games - R3d Logs

They are named based off their date. It looks like [2015-1-5T...r3dlog.txt]

Digital Ram - Same problem here

100% packet loss from me to 192.64.174.33 on a ping -t

trace route included below

tracert 192.64.174.163

Tracing route to 192.64.174.163 over a maximum of 30 hops

Trace complete.

This can help with it, but might not solve it all the way. Give it a try.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues

This is ridiculous i have no packet loss and no internet instability, and i cant spectate a game from the LoL client...really upsetting

not sure how to take a screenshot of this but its exactly like yours only my time is avg 75 and my TTL is 44
0% packet loss
Still waiting on some idea on whats goin on! Thx guys!

Thanks for the reply! Here is the latest one, and there is about 50 more that I before that but I figure just upload this one to start and see what you can see. TY SO MUCH for the reply! I hope to hear back from you sir! Have a good day/night!
